questions.question_text:
A user has access only to the vRealize Operations Product UI.
Which component will be available when they log in?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It will be only Dashboards page - user do not have admin gui

questions.question_text:
An administrator needs to configure vRealize Operations cost drivers to allocate the cost of database software across a vSphere cluster that has been licensed.

Which type of cost driver should the administrator configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
License cost driver. This cost driver is used to allocate costs associated with software licenses, including database software

questions.question_text: Which two Remote Checks are available in vRealize Operations to manage Telegraf Agents on a virtual machine? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Interrelate the object in the Object Relationships section in the vRealize Operations Administration Console.
choices.A: Add vRealize Log Insight as a collector in the vRealize Operations Administration Console.
choices.B: Enable log forwarding in the vRealize Operations Administration Console.
choices.E: Configure vRealize Operations in vRealize Log Insight.
choices.C: Configure the vRealize Log Insight integration from the vRealize Operations interface.

questions.question_text: Which two steps must be performed to access the Troubleshoot with Logs dashboard from vRealize Operations? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Correct:
C. Configure the vRealize Log Insight integration from the vRealize Operations interface.
E. Configure vRealize Operations in vRealize Log Insight.

Selected Answer: AD
Correct only required is Symptom and Action here is more:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.6/com.vmware.vcom.core.doc/GUID-69F159E4-0BE0-4605-A9F9-AEDA146F8241.html

questions.question_text: What are the two required components of an alert definition? (Choose two.)
